direction.raw_text: ! IMPERIAL DODGERS NO! Four of us at the table glued to the T.V, watching U.S. Attorney Welles Noonan lambasting the LAPD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LA's version of the Young Turks, only meaner. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boyce Bradley, Chief of Detectives. Smartest man in town. And one of the richest: Dad was a Real Estate Developer who owned a strip of land that's now known as the Santa Monica Freeway. On either side, Bradley's book-ends: D.A. Bob Gallaudet, not the smartest man in town: `Gas Chamber' Bob cribbed my notes at USC Law. And Tom Bethune, running for a City Council seat that'll decide if this Mexican slum called Chavez Ravine gets bulldozed and renamed `Dodger Stadium.'              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn it off. Bethune leaps like a lapdog, hits the power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was pissing. He was jumping. Bradley picks up a newspaper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `US Attorney Noonan is accusing the Los Angeles Police Department in general, and Lt. David Klein in particular, of murder at worst, gross incompetence at best...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noonan had Sanderline scared. After he sang to me he panicked & jumped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did spend a month in Camarillo Mental Hospital last year-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and wearing that hotel robe over his clothes makes him look even more looney-bin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plus, Reuben Ruiz recanted. So Noonan's Boxing Probe is dead. He's got nothing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -but time, a mandate and new targets...I need to speak to the Lieutenant alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bob and Tom nod, pat my back on the way out: proud uncles lending support before Dad drops the hammer. Door closes. I stand, step to the window, big Pro-Mex protest below: Geeks and placards: `BASEBALL IS AS AMERICAN AS THE TRAIL OF TEARS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Describe to me your duty, as you understood it, regarding Sanderline Johnson and Reuben Ruiz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take both men into custody before Noonan and the Feds could, and find                   * out what they were going to tell-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and why did I choose you for this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm a Cop with a law degree, and you thought my legal-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -because your a thug with a law degree. Because I thought by now you'd be so indebted to this Department for not indicting and/or                   * imprisoning you, that diligent, honest discharge of duty would be assured. (beat) And I made a horrible misjudgment.                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bethune and Gallaudet don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob's happy because he wants to be State Attorney General and his most likely opponent will be Welles Noonan. Tom's happy because Morton Diskant, who's leading their City Council race, is endorsed by Noonan. Thus, they're not seeing the larger play. (with calculated emphasis) Noonan's new target will likely be the LAPD itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because that's where I would aim: a subpoenaed Federal witness plummets to his death in the company of two
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: detectives? (beat) This screams Police Corruption.                      * This offers Noonan the possibility of payback in the form of national headlines. I wave it all off:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnson did that stint at the Nut House -- leak his file to your friends at the times- -and Bradley drops his bomb: Coroner's file. I stare...guess the contents...try to keep my heart rate in-check...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friends would be more interested in this. (beat, flipping file open) Coroner's preliminary: white paint chips found embedded in Sanderline Johnson's scalp. A matching dent on the white window sill. I checked with the hotel switchboard and found a call was patched to your room at about the same time Johnson flew out of it. (beat, proclamation:) It shocks and sickens me that your allegiance to the Chicago mob would take precedence over the LAPD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fuck drawing this out) Alright. Where's this going?                         * (pull my badge, table it) Gun? Shield? What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The appearance of disciplinary measures taken against you are mandated post-Sanderline Johnson,                    * so your suspension will be recorded but sealed...and kept quiet for now-                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if the papers or Noonan come sniffing around-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -we can provide adequate proof of your dismissal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're not dismissing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just on paper. (closes the file) Since I misjudged the Cop I thought you were, I'm going to leverage the Cop that you are. Bradley slides the morning paper over. Front page: `Candidate Diskant Hears The Hue and Cry of The Underclass...' The photo shows a smiling Diskant, rolled shirt-sleeves, in the middle     * of a sea of LA Immigrants, all smiling back.                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morton Diskant is to be removed from the City Council race. The means and methods implemented to that end I will entrust to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (throw a thumb at Bethune) You want me to torpedo Diskant so your buddy Bethune can win a City                      * Council seat uncontested-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -or spend the next month in lock-up                    * before being arraigned on charges                      * of gross misconduct and dereliction                    * of duty. The preamble before you                       * face life in prison for murder.                        * I stare back. Feel myself getting fitted for strings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diskant works Saturdays. Late. Bradley waves me out. I intentionally drag my badge back across the desk, scratching his Mahogany heirloom.               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 7   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - MORNING                                7 Hollywood Hills loom in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bradley's stooge now. A smart play suspending me: a built-in shield                        * for him if things go sideways. Traffic teeming up Fairfax, tourettes-like glances in my rear- view...a Black Buick...maybe mirroring my lane changes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black Buick...five Cars back...feels like a tail... Brake hard. They hang a left on Fountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...or maybe I just need sleep. Cruising up Nichols Canyon to the pad, cameras and copywriters loom on my front lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Press camped out post-Sanderline, looking for quotes to hang me with.                     * Slouch in the seat, accelerate, keep looking back...dig that geek from the Hearld pissing in my hedges. 8   EXT. WESTWOOD COTTAGE - MORNING                               8 Up the walkway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Retreat to Meg's. My kid sister and only living family. Mom and Pop died in `51 when their first plane ride became their last. Scoop Meg's LA Herald of the ground. Headlines condemn me. Tuck it under my arm as Meg opens the door:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glances from paper to me) I already got the Times inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 9   INT. WESTWOOD COTTAGE - MOMENTS LATER                         9 Silver tea-pot over blue flame on olive-drab stove. The Times open on the table between us...Same shitty headlines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many times have I lied to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero. Shrug. Play aloof. Hope it suffices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've always liked your Men mean. She looks up at me. Feels the shame I shun...                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would Mom and Dad say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. That's where I learned it. She stands, goes to the stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, pour me...a cup please. Black, no sugar. Meg stares darts. I smile to defuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty please. She fetches cups and saucers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's work?                                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's Pete?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More work. Quiet while we wait for the pot...and quiet always means creeping sleep: an Enemy I never stop fighting. Force my eyes open, shift in my seat: I've been exhausted for years. I drift despite my best efforts and for a split second you see the Hell I see when sleep wins: 10   INT./EXT. NIGHTMARE                                          10 Fire where the clouds should be -- POP -- in a backseat, point-blank Tommy-gunning two smiling men -- POP -- Marine fatigues soaked in blood, plunging my bayonet into a cheesecake-white belly -- POP -- that beautiful blonde from       * the Olympic, smiling -- POP-                                      * 11   INT. WESTWOOD COTTAGE - SAME MOMENT                          11 -awake. My leg jerks, kicks a big Wing-Tip. A cup of coffee pipes in front of me. Then voices. I turn: PETE BONDURANT has his hands on my sister's shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Pete Bondurant. One-time LA Sheriff. Bounced when he beat-dead a Prisoner who spit at him. A duly impressed Howard Hughes hired him on as his full-time muscle. My Sister's new Hump. My oldest living Friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns back at me) You look like Death taking a shit. Meg cackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still got that MGM-face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still the only guy who ever traded movie-potential for Police work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because in the movies they make you pull your punches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Drain my mug. To Pete:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna do LAPD a favor tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We're going to the Cocoanut- -Pete puts an extended index finger in front of Meg's lips, which she bends backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Favor' mean `free?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Means $500 an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme the phone so I can find another Date-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -you're the only Woman I know who calls Men-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -you're the only Man I know who doesn't call Women. Pete laughs, then:                                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we doing? 12   EXT. LOW RENT OFFICE BUILDING, EAST LA - NIGHT            12 Me and Junior in the car. Pete street-side, tucked into the shadows -- mimes jacking off, checks his watch. Everybody bored. Glance again at the file in my lap:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morton Diskant, a man who preferred migrant workers to million dollar ballparks. Beating Bethune in their City Council Race despite getting outspent 10 to 1. (beat) If he wins, the Dodgers don't get a Stadium, Mexicans get to keep raising chickens two miles from City Hall and Bradley makes sure I                   * burn for Sanderline Johnson.                         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Junior in the backseat, penning in a steno, mouthing something to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior brought along because he begged. Already hip to how many ways you can make money with a badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a birthday coming up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the 16th, right? How old?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old. What are you writing?                          * Head down, scribbling mid-sentence, makes me wait a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just notes...about work-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -what `work'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mostly compare and contrast stuff. Street work versus textbook-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -chapter 1: don't write shit down. Chapter 2: or other Cops might kill                 * you. Junior's look practiced in a mirror: clicks the pen, slides the steno away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you think Noonan will come after you for the Sanderline thing? He seems like a real hard charger. Bait him, see if he bites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (the deadest deadpan) I heard he was coming after both of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Feature real concern from Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indictments. Prison time. Whole nine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Jesus. Is this true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm seriously thinking about turning Junior...testifying against you. Junior goes sour...gets he's being goosed. I laugh, glance out the windshield: see Diskant finally exiting the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we go. I start the car, slow-roll up the street. My Hamilton says 11:04 PM. Streets deserted. Pete walking in Diskant's direction now as I continue to roll toward both. Pete close, dig his giant head nodding `hello.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seen Pete do this a dozen times and every time the same thought: Pete suddenly puts his back into an left hook: hammers Diskant from nowhere as they pass. Instant-ugly crumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God help me if he ever hits me like that. Pete hoists Diskant by his waist-band, tosses him in the backseat. I accelerate out, obeying every law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : PITCH BLACK. Then a series of strobe-flashbulbs: maybe flesh, maybe two bodies, maybe both hairy/pale. Then groaning, then flickering fluorescent lights make it all look jaundiced. 13   INT. LOW RENT FUCK-TEL ROOM - SAME MOMENT                    13 Lights now. Diskant awake, trying to loosen his jaw. 18.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior picked up this Quiff jocking other Fags in a Men's Room. But Quiff was a Law Student who wanted his record kept clean. Quiff nervous but cooing, dick out, on Diskant's thigh. Junior just as nervous...reloading a camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He should suck his dick. Y'know? Put the icing on it. A baffled moment as the comment registers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me that wouldn't sell it...plus he's a Communist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're ruining his career, not his soul. Reload the camera. Diskant finally speaks: marble-mouthed. Pushes Quiff away:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off me! Don't waste a second: grab Diskant by the hair, narrate his immediate future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop out of the City Council race or I send these pictures to the papers. Diskant rips his head free. Rage. Blood from his mouth.         * Scanning the room, sizing up the situation, then:               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll fight you rotten-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and maybe salvage something that's a close cousin to `respect.' But what about your wife and kid getting hold of those pictures?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wait for the big futile scream/struggle. Keep waiting. Diskant just sits. No words. And now I wish he'd cry, throw punches, anything...but he doesn't. I turn to Junior:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the Quiff home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name's Franklin-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -of course it is. Junior pulls Quiff out the door. By his hand. Just Pete, Me, and Diskant now. Silent moments drag sour...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a nod from you Morton, let's me know you get it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -don't say my name...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone from the Times will call for a quote. Whatever your reason for dropping out make it real. As Pete and I turn to leave:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not looking at us) You eventually lose the ability to reconcile the things you've done to people. That's Hell. A long moment on me and Pete. Blunted by what we just heard. 14   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - NEXT MOMENT                        14 Pete driving. Silence. Tune to an all-night Jazz signal, turn up the volume loud enough to jumble doubts. Toss Pete his cut. A $500 roll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pocketing the money) Y'know Hughes has a job you're tailor-made for. I already gave him your-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -no thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop pretending you're not a pig for all this, Klein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still got a day job, Pete-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -tossing more Bantamweights out                       * windows? I wait too long, answer in too high a voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mutt jumped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs small, then:) Not even the people who don't know you believe that. If somebody from the DA's office decides to dig, you could fry Boy-o. Be nice to be in with a billionaire who's got a fleet of planes, fly you outta the country on a moment's notice. (beat) C'mon -- it's a cake legal gig. He                    * just wants you to burn some actress that stopped fucking him. Stop in front of Meg's place. Pete leaves the engine running, jumps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow. Hughes Aircraft, 7pm                        * It'll be worth it. I watch Pete go into Meg's place. Drive on. Stop sign. A block away: Black Buick parallel to me. Exhaust plumes. Like they're waiting. I keep my eyes on the rear-view as I pass...but it just stays put...idling. 15   INT. MY HOME, HOLLYWOOD HILLS - MOMENTS LATER             15 Lights off but something grabs my eye instantly. Kitchen table: a manila envelope. 100 $100-bills. USC season tickets. A note: `Thanks for proving Flying Monkeys only live in Oz. Sam G.' Exhale. Flip to the same jazz station. Sit. Start another futile fight with sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The last thing I see before I nod black: my War Trophy, a Japanese Officer's Samurai Sword mounted on my mantle. SMASH CUT TO: 16   INT./EXT. NIGHTMARE                                            16 Artillery barrages from Hell: Okinawa, 1945. A hate-fueled frenzy hacking up half-starved Jap Soldiers. They dive off the Cliffs to escape me: this massive, gray-eyed Marine. I dive after them. Bombing toward a world below already ablaze. Falling. Gaining on a figure in a bathrobe. This guttural scream turns mechanical, like a ring as I recognize Sanderline Johnson: his pieced-together face smiling up. Snap awake. My phone ringing. 1 AM. Rip the phone from the wall:         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klein-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -you know who Hector Magdalena is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as cobwebs clear) ...yeah...Narco's Snitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's missing. His home was broken into at some point within the last hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So send Robbery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only thing taken was him. Wilshire Station is on-scene. Get over there right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call it penance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought that's what Morton Diskant was-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -that makes one of us. 1284 South                         * Tremaine. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (edge to his voice) This kind of timing makes for disasters, Lieutenant. I hear the first split-second of Bradley smashing his phone down. Click my own cradle. Wipe my face. Dial another number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior. Meet me at 1284 South                         * Tremaine. 20 minutes. 17   EXT. 1284 SOUTH TREMAINE, MAGDALENA RESIDENCE - LATE NIGHT 17 Police abound. Mostly work-a-day Blues pounding coffee. They part as I approach: Dave "Enforcer" Klein half-legend here. A plain-clothes breaks through, aims right at me: DAN WILHITE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Dan Wilhite, Head of the
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: LOW RENT OFFICE BUILDING, EAST LA

direction.raw_text: Narcotics Division. A Michigan Catholic poisoned by 25 years in this desert. Recently divorced despite seven kids with his Ex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You smell like bourbon Wilhite-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -fuck off. This is handled. And pull your idiot partner out of there-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Junior's already here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Magdalena was my Snitch, so it's my scene. -push past him, toward the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then get Bradley on the horn, so you can relay that order. I'm here on his word. Now, what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dragged out of him) Guard dogs are dead. Magdalena's missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And presumed what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could give a shit. I just want to this case to get a quick burial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bet. Who made the call?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some old broad heard an `argument' and buzzed Wilshire Station.                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wife and daughter were in Santa Barbara. Just got back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (check my Hamilton) At 2 AM?                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * The Wife said she got into a fight          * with her Parents, left ASAP.                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * Why wasn't Hector with `em?                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think they were                 * fighting about? Santa Barbara Wasps         * don't fancy dope-pushing Wetbacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the Son?                         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sneering hatred) Tommy. Make him your #1 suspect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that?                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got a mean streak. And he and          * Hector had been at each others throats for months. Have Tommy              * picked up. He likes to loaf at              * those nigger jazz joints in Watts.          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, you better cut out before                      * people start asking why the head of Narco is at a missing persons. Wilhite gets close, still sneering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a conviction. Grab Tommy and pin this thing fast or you'll have a whole division of disgraced cops at your front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about Wilhite?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You queered the Fed's   Fight Probe by killing that boxer   and they already had a hard-on   for the LAPD-                   * Bradley sent you down   here as damaged goods...think   about it. Everybody sees what's   coming. (beat, closer) Now close this quick. Wilhite bolts. I pause. Clarity finally dissolving the            * bloodshot: this is the disaster Bradley was talking about:        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The God-sized problems I triggered tossing Sanderline take shape: the LAPD's sanctioned dope-pusher vanishes -- that's a pretty juicy                       * spot to stick a new probe.                              * 18   INT. MAGDALENA RESIDENCE - MOMENTS LATER                     18 All money, no taste. In the foyer: a Wilshire Station six- pack interviews the old BIDDIE in a threadbare bathrobe. Dyed orange hair and a burnt-butter grin. Leans-lunges as she relays her story. I zoom in to catch the performance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mid-sentence) -shifty...colored...y'know Negros are planning an invasion! After our white women and our water supply-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -where was this Peeper you saw?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bushes. Spyin' on Lucille. Seen him                   * there before! He's a black saboteur                   * looking for fertile white wombs. Wanna breed a mulatto master race-                    * -cut into the crazy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer. The Six-Pack crosses to confer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Besides bat-shit insanity, is there anything else about her that rings true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heard an argument, loud, maybe a minute or two, then silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this `Peeper' riff she's on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She saw someone in the bushes earlier. She's reported that kind of thing a dozen other times. She's also reported flying saucers, so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See if any of the other Neighbors can verify this `Peeper' thing.                       * Roam. A hallway. Junior the grim-faced professional, He's got that damn steno out, scribbling like he's on a deadline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one touch a thing `til I say. He's hovering over a lake of blood, drag marks originating in that lake lead out to the garage. Junior sees me. See him startle, then jut his tough-guy chin on reflex:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Lieutenant Klein. I said `meet me' in twenty minutes' not `go in without me.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I've been doing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hard/harsh/low) -is stepping on dicks. You don't know the history, the players or the play. Pull Junior aside, impart the following tightly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Department gave Magdalena a                      * monopoly on the LA dope trade decades ago-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -what Department?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Us Pollyanna -- LAPD. We bullet- proofed him in exchange for 60% of his profit and a promise he only deal drugs in Darktown and East LA-                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Black and Mexican-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -give the man a prize. He'd also                     * rat his competition and kill the ones we couldn't convict. Now keep your mouth shut and stay on my hip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.                                                * I want to bounce his head off the wall. I continue my tour instead. Follow the blood-trail out into the garage where it   * ends in another smaller lake of blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * Loaded him into a car-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -are all the Magdalena vehicles accounted for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except for the Son's: Tommy.                         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Continue the tour. Kitchen. Two Dobermans, shot dead. Feature matching bullet wounds right between their eyes -- yell to      * the Officer with the Biddie:                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As he pokes his head around the corner:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old lady hear dogs barking?                       * Gunshots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I asked. Just the yelling. Examine the wounds closer. Catch myself petting the deceased pooches. To Junior:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't hear barking...so they were either lousy guard dogs...or they knew the Killer. (point to the wounds) You can't hit something this clean unless you're point blank. He could've been petting them when he fired: look at the burn pattern-                      * (point) Like when you shoot something with a silencer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stare so he gets it) I've shot things with silencers... And the old lady didn't hear any                      * gunshots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make a family member for it? Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe...                                              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to issue an APB?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk to Bradley first. Where are the Mother and Daughter?                   * 19   INT. FAMILY ROOM - CONTINUOUS                             19 Feature this old Matriarch hanging by the thinnest thread:     * MADGE MAGDALENA, fifty-plus, dyed blonde bouffant pulled at and picked. Sad clown tears smearing too much mascara. She pitches a boo-hoo in between belts of wine to a bored stiff Wilshire Station six-pack. LUCILLE MAGDALENA, 20's: Daughter. Big bedroom eyes. A top two sizes too tight. Pops a palm of pills. Doesn't look too shattered about Daddy's demise. I make eye contact. I catch    * bruises on her arms. She sees me see, tries to cover           * nonchalant. The wall phone rings. Grab without asking.         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Klein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Update.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector's gone. Blood that may or may not be his leads out to the                      * garage. Two guard dogs shot dead but no other signs of a struggle. The house is intact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wife and Daughter are here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Describe their state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Madge aggrieved.                              * (aim my gaze at Lucille) Daughter Lucille...indifferent. The                  * son is persona non grata and a strong early suspect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, kick everyone out. Including all police personnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't question me. Is your partner on hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...                                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have him bag and seal everything and bring it to Wilshire Station. Find Tommy Magdalena post-haste and take him into custody. No APB's, nothing to alert Noonan and the FBI to this situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -no more information over an open                     * line. I'll be at the Bethune event later on today. Find me there. Click. Second time he's hung up on me in an hour. Pull Junior to me just as he's going through a stack of mail:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm giving you on-scene command.                      * Bradley wants everyone removed from the premises and the entire house bagged for evidence and brought to Wilshire Station. (more of a dare) Can you handle this? Big brown-nose nods from an aim-to-please Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Entirely. Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To find Tommy Magdalena. 20   INT. CAR - EARLY MORNING                                  20 Rolling up Hollywood to Highland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big yawns. Half haze from no sleep. Buzz dispatch. A message from Pete. `Reminder: Hughes aircraft, 7 PM.                      * Glance street-side: Sanderline smiling blood in a wind blown bathrobe. Blink and he's gone, replaced by a kid hawking the Times. Pull-over. Toss the kid a coin. Front page: LEADING CANDIDATE BOWS FROM CITY COUNCIL RACE, next to a picture of Diskant. Pissed for reasons I won't name. Back to the Car. A Black Buick passes, slower than the rest of traffic, act like I'm oblivious. It turns. I slide in, start my Pontiac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another Black Buick. Call it a Fed                     * Tail. Noonan already up my ass.                        * (beat) Let's see if they got guts enough to keep following me South. 21   EXT. DARKTOWN - DAWN                                        21 Cruising the Crenshaw district, up through Central Ave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dispatch gave me Tommy's make and model: A `32 Ford Deuce with a bent eight. Hot-rodder Tommy liked to goose the cops into giving chase. Check my mirrors. That Black Buick hangs way back. Cruise past jazz clubs: The Savoy, Joe Morris's Plantation, Shepp's Playhouse, the Down Beat...no sign of a Ford Deuce. Pull up to the Club Alabam. Valets stare: a white man in Watts at this hour can only be Cop. Park.                                 * Half-a-block back: buzzcuts in that black Buick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noonan tail confirmed: Fed faces                       * glow like Martians this far down Crenshaw. Smile big, give `em a thumbs-up. 22   INT. CLUB ALABAM - DAWN                                     22 Barely sober patrons sport Cop-hate stares, some on reflex,      * some because of Sanderline Johnson.                              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Doorman escort the bewildered, strong-arm the belligerent.      * Almost 6 AM and the club is still half full. Press on, scan the stage: A Bebop trio toils over an Erroll Garner tune as a beautiful black girl sings in a satin soft lilt. This whispering falsetto that makes your hair stand on end. I stop and listen. Get my only smile of the day from       * her. Smile back because her voice reminds me to. Hear beer bottles rattle behind and break. Turn. Squeeze that smile into a sneer, stare down this massive BARTENDER.          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flop badge on bar) Get Lester and get me a scotch                        * straight.                                             * The bartender glowers, grabs a bottle, pours, hands the size    * of catcher's mitts. He slides the glass. I sip.                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanderline Johnson was my second                      * cousin, Peckerwood. I wouldn't                        * drink that with my gun hand. He vanishes behind a stained curtain. Feel those voodoo         * stares from behind...and I switch the scotch glass to my left   * hand as nonchalant as possible. Bartender reappears, motions me back. I follow. Backstage. I see a figure stretched prone, ice-pack pressed to his face, rolled reefer between his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lester Lake. One-time velvet voiced crooner. But a dabble in the dope trade cost him a set of slashed vocal cords at the hands of none                      * other than Hector Magdalena.                          * Only as I get closer do I see the badly swollen black eye. He looks up at me. A voice like sand-paper left out in the sun:    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lieutenant Dave Klein. Slayer of                      * Sanderline Johnson...y'got stones                     * showing up this far South.                            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Tommy Mag wanted to make sure I understood something he was saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left an hour ago. Emptied my safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He's wise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To what? You looking for him? Lester hands me the reefer, take it, toke geeky, belch smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (at the reefer) Just never got this... Lester takes it back, draws deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too white to appreciate good grass.                   * Now watch Lester's attitude improve toot sweet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector Magdalena is missing, presumed dead. Tommy is our sole suspect. He spurts smoke, sits up like a shot, beams.                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muthafucker -- there is a God. If only I'd known this an hour ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heartbreaker, huh? You let him gig here last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't let him, he just does. Nails on a chalkboard too. He rushed the stage last week when we had Charlie Mingus drop in for a set. Mingus looked at this half-Mex                   * greaser kid trying to play `Round                     * Midnight,' said that fool couldn't                    * find them keys with a flashlight.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy's playing days are over.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LEADING CANDIDATE BOWS FROM CITY COUNCIL RACE,

direction.raw_text: Hallelujah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time did he show up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around four. Him and these Pachucos         * poppin' switchblades like punks. (mops his brow of blood) The only thing that was keepin' him         * `untouched' was Hector...                   * (beat, hopeful-prayer) Is he really dead?                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's blood all over his house, seems to belong to him. There's just no body. Not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a toke, a thought) I don't feature Tommy for it.               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (my head kinks a bit)                   * How's that? How many times has he           * been in here, busted you up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but he ain't got the salt             * to truly take a Man's life.                 * Especially not Hector's...he was            * scared of him.                              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * Why?                                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * `Cuz Hector been whippin' Tommy's           * ass from the time he could talk.            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * What about the Wife? Beat her too?          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * We used to call that old bitch `the         * Burglar'...eyes were so black, it           * looked like she had a mask on.              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * And the daughter? Lucille?                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lester can't quip that one as quick. Tokes. Shaking his head.   *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things up off the street. Rumors.                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like?                                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector had turned her out. Using                      * her the way the Romans used to use                    * their daughters when they did                         * business: Some pussy to sweeten the                   * pot. Rumor was she got picked up in                   * this trick sweep few weeks back.                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector was whoring her?                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector was an evil Muthafucker.                       * ...Lester tilts his neck back, points to a long keloid scar     * that stretches across his throat...                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...born with ruthless bones.                          * (sitting up)                                      * And if he really is dead and gone,                    * this game `bout to explode.                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What game?                                            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drugs. Especially here in South Central. Hector ran it uncontested. Lotta cats gonna rush in now, try to plant a flag.                                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy can't hold the throne?                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy couldn't hold his pecker without Hector's help and he knows                    * that. He's gonna bury himself like                    * a tick. Good luck turning him up,                     * he took six or seven grand out the                    * safe tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes and ears for me Lester. He turns up, you get in touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I don't kill him first.                              * 23   EXT. UNION STATION BALLROOM - DAY                            23 Bethune Campaign Fundraiser turned Victory Bash. Big smiles beam above sunburned double-chins. Bethune the nucleus of a Press circle-jerk. I weave around, lack of sleep and a miserably wrinkled suit make me look like something dug up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Councilman Bethune, was Mr. Diskant dropping out the only way you could have won this race?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all. My message of civic advancement manifested in that beautiful blue baseball team was starting to hit home. Bethune's beam twitches when he sees me weaving past. Give him a quick nod, get nothing back: he can't be seen this close to the turd in the punch bowl. Moving by:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything you'd like to say to future constituents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like my Dodger Dogs with mustard and relish! Bradley at one of the front tables confabbing with DA Gas Chamber Bob Gallaudet. As I aim their way, one of my favorite     * men aims at me, wearing this Great White grin: FRITZ KOENIG.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fritz Koenig. German born. Former                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spymaster, current Head of the                       * LAPD's Intelligence Division. He                        * and Bradley in the middle of their own Cold War -- each fighting to be the second most important member of                     * the LAPD behind Chief Parker.                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These functions aren't normally               * open to Jews.                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone with your accent should               * never be allowed to say `Jew'                 * again.                                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That accent allowed me to execute             * many a Nazi.                                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we're both Traitors: Ellis               * Island said Grandpa's `Kleinsasser'           * was two syllables too long.                   *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't have expected so public a showing after Sanderline Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jumped Fritz. Koenig flashes that grin again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he did. And where is your young partner this day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working his first big job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might the job involve the LAPD's most important missing Wetback, Hector Magdalena? My eyes narrow but stay smiling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does. Koenig nods, casts his gaze out over the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've known Stemmons since the academy. He was a top pupil. A                * peculiar little pain in the ass, but very good with details.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid might have some climb in him. (look back at Bradley) Reminds me of another pain in the ass. Koenig roars this big frightening laugh of his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm puzzled as to why the Bradley would assign you to the Magdalena                     * case when you're neither Homicide nor Robbery...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no body, and nothing was taken except Hector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does know how to delegate doesn't he...and also I'm sure that poor Negro's nosedive has put you squarely in his debt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.                                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep me abreast will you? Chief Parker is understandably nervous. Situations like these tend to yield grief...and we've the FBI poking                      * around our garden patch.                              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ass first Fritz, yours second. Koenig's big laugh again. Moving toward Bradley now. Then flashbulbs pop-blind. Panic: snapping pix of me? Relief: not me. Hollywood types: this Buff McMan Meat-type and Her. I go slack inches from the Press that yesterday wanted to roll in my guts...but now they're just as entranced with her as I am. She and McMan Meat continue past as I stare, she answers his questions for him. I think her eyes see mine. Then I realize where I'm standing. Bradley waiting. Focused on me and not her -- God-damned Eunuch. I step over, speak without preface:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy Magdalena has gone to ground and he's got a war chest to keep him there. The only way we take him quickly is to issue a citywide APB- 38.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -no. We can't risk that. Do you             * make him for the murderer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Hector's disappearance is definitely an inside job. That whole family feels hinky. The daughter was all bruises and no tears and Hector's hop-head wife            * looks part punching bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you suspect either of the women?         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to Wilhite, they were in Santa Barbara at the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Verify that. Where is your partner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vouching in evidence at Wilshire Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep him on that. He had excellent ratings as an evidence teacher and          * I trust him more than you. (beat) Find Tommy Magdalena. Focus everything on that effort & I want him apprehended Klein, not killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Hector? Still missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And most likely dead. Find the Son.         * Stakeout the residence. Put tails on both the mother and daughter -- I want this investigation working quietly, and around the clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * And what do we do if Hector turns           * up?                                         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's alive, bring him to me. If he's dead, have him John Doe'd at                    * the morgue until Noonan can be                       * drawn off and this FBI situation                     * sorted out.                                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilhite. He was operating Hector-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -don't worry about Dan Wilhite. You deal directly with me. Now go out the back. I don't want the press recognizing you. Swallow my sneer. Push through the service doors. Hard. Headed back toward the kitchen, an exit sign. I pass an alcove: Her. Alone. Smoke break. Beauty you almost never get to examine up close. I stop, stammer, she gives me a once- over, thinks I'm a Reporter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a light?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (searches my empty hands) You got a cigarette? I fumble for a Chesterfield. She pulls a Zippo slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you snap a picture of me, I get to set you on fire. Fair? I smile too wide -- fuck. I kill it, try to gather up the bits of `cool' that shattered with the sophomore smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It didn't look like you were all that upset with the attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thing you're not a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your power of observation leaves lots to be desired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lights my cigarette. I hold it in my mouth to hide shaking hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't thank me: these things are bad for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe everything you read? Stubs her cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe anything you read? She starts walking back the way I came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hail-mary) Do you eat Dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I can't stop watching her, even after she pushes back through the double doors, re-entering the fray head-first. I step after her. A reporter finally makes me. Random catcalls of `Klein! `Hey, Enforcer!' Shutterbugs beeline my way, firing flashbulbs from the hip. Close the door quick and bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a note: steal Bethune's guest-                     * list, then go door-to-door until                        * you find her again. 24   INT. WILSHIRE STATION - DAY                                  24 Stroll. Sidelong stares on the periphery. Muted whispers from     * desk cops. Feature this rookie chump clear a path as I pass.      * Down a flight of stairs to the evidence lockers. Junior writes seizure abstracts, sealing materials in green-banded       * evidence bags. A pile stacked neatly on the table next to him. That red steno pad in full view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This everything from the house? A beat. He makes me wait as he finishes writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything worthwhile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you tell the Watch Commander upstairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (schoolboy proud) That this was a random drug seizure. I'm not using names and I'm number coding everything. A load of interesting stuff too. (points to each stack) I got unregistered fire-arms, more dope than I've ever seen, and some mail from business associates that seems hinky. We should follow up-           * (grabs an envelope)                     * -here, this one, `Hurwitz Holdings'         * Hector had some real estate dealings-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -bag it until Bradley orders us otherwise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (like I'm speaking Greek)               * How do you solve a case when the evidence is in bags?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't. Our job is to find Tommy. (point to the red steno) And why is that out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (like he's caught) I'm making notes separate from- (gear change off my glare) -I thought we were investigating Magdalena's disappearance-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Don't write shit down. What do you         * need Kid? A little bouncing ball,           * bottom of the screen?                       * (brace him harder) Magdalena is twenty years dirty with this Department...do you think         * a word of that exists on paper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there's reasons. Respect them.                      * Junior tucks the steno away, chastened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we need surveillance set up on the house and revolving tails on both Madge and Lucille Magdalena. Their alibi is they were in Santa Barbara when Hector vanished. Find out if that's real. The tails and the stakeout start tonight. (beat) Can you manage this? Junior jacks his chin just high enough to save face, tucks that steno away, this X-Ray stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, Lieutenant.                                       * 25   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - DAY                                   25   * Rolling. Crenshaw south. Darktown.                                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police blotter gets me bupkis. Buzz                     * dispatch. Looking for license hits                      * on that `32 Ford Deuce. Nothing.                        * Zoom Darktown again. Zilch. Tommy                       * dug in deep.                                            * Startle, check my watch: 7:17 pm.                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. 26   INT. HUGHES AIRCRAFT HANGAR - EVENING                        26   * Cruise in, crossing the hangar to Pete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howard Hughes. Billionaire germ freak. Boob man. Pete's prime benefactor. Nobody had seen him in years. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he only communicated through a small standing army of lapdog lawyers he kept on staff. A small, effete blonde man: GEOFFREY MILTEER extends his tiny hand, plastic-cordial, rubbed raw from waiting...                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gregory Milteer. Attorney-at-Law. A pleasure Lt. Klein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave. Sorry I'm late.                                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed. (motions to sit) Please. We sit at a huge drafting table. I shoot a sidelong to Pete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for your time on a Sunday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a wink for Pete) Where's Mr. Hughes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unavailable. Unfortunately. But I've been given full authority to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -I'm not contagious...if that's what he's worried about. Pete hate scowls me: have your fun, Asshole...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't find that the least bit humorous Lt. Klein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do. What's your pitch Mr.                      * Milteer? Milteer looks at Pete. Pete half-shrugs. Back to me now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An `Actress' named Glenda Bledsoe signed a Service Contract that she's now willfully violating by acting in a Z-grade horror picture presently `shooting' in Griffith Park. Despite entreaties for her to cease participation in this absurdity, she continues to revel in her outlaw status with us. Thus we would like her destroyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think I can do a better job than your people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bondurant says you're one of the smarter people he knows-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -dubious honor if you knew the other people Pete knows. (beat) So you want to catch her in violation of her Service Contract? Something like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. The morality clause in particular as the damage to her reputation would be most devastating: Nymphomaniac, Criminal, Communist...anything along these lines. Once you visit the set of her `Attack of the Atomic Vampires,' you'll see the void that is her character. We haven't a photograph handy, but she's playing the lead female role.         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm happy to help. But my price is $10,000. Not 5. Pete laughs out loud. Milteer goes frigid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $10,000 should buy more than help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For 10 give it any name you want. I'm a salaried employee of LAPD,                      * that means I'll have to find time off hours to do this. A long, cold moment drags...                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agreed. Start tonight. Someone's                      * been stealing groceries from our talent domiciles. There's no proof that it's her, but it's her. Peter will provide you addresses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (faux fey) Thank you Peter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look forward to your updates. 27   INT. PAY PHONE ON SEPULVEDA - LATE AFTERNOON              27 Dialing the Station:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant, pass a message to Stemmons: I want him to meet me at the one-thousand block of South Tremaine tonight at 11 and at some point between now and then, I'll need him to do a preliminary work- up on a woman named Glenda Bledsoe. (beat, check spelling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Thanks. I hang up, step out, yawn. 28   EXT. ATOMIC VAMPIRE SET - DUSK                            28 Two-fisting coffees. On top of a hill overlooking the `Atomic Vampires' shoot. Pure schlock. The spaceship: a totaled Cadillac replete with home-made canopy and cardboard extensions on the fins. Crew: homeless winos. Extras: homeless drug-fiends. Scan the assembled `talent'...and see: HER. My black and white picture. The Beauty at the fight. The starlet I threw a Hail Mary dinner pass to at Bethune's victory party: GLENDA BLEDSOE. Emerging from a small trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twice in a day doesn't happen. Not in a city like LA. Not like this. (beat) This is fate. This is Cupid firing his whole fucking quiver. Move. Make sure she's real. HER laughing. Melodic. I hike down through the bramble. 29   EXT. ATOMIC VAMPIRE SET - DUSK                               29 Walk past a pair of beat Airstream Clippers. Watch her propping up this silver-haired junkie. She grabs a sound blanket, drapes him, hands him her coffee before siting down next to another Woman and rehearsing. I eyeball the rest of the `set.' Winos in werewolf masks and capes, holding wooden ray-guns spray-painted silver: One pisses, bottle in one hand, cigarette/dick in the other. The "Director" is a fey manic, fingering a snuff-box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the big Armada landing, so I need everybody's energy up, up up! Where's my Alien Commander? The Pissing WEREWOLF careens back to set, pulling at his zipper, mask askew, covering his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MICKEY COHEN, 62, former mob boss. He boils eggs on a hot- plate and slings hash to extras lining plywood picnic tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mickey Cohen: one-time LA crime kingpin and West Coast Mob heavy who now trawls for loose change. Winos vibe LAPD, make a hole as I approach:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cecil B. Demoted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where Klein goes tsuris follows. This is what I hate about being down, lip from the likes of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If this is `down' I never want to see `out.' How the mighty have fallen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gives it right back) Which one of us are you talking about Klein? Word is the Federal Bureau is all hot and bothered with you Gonif. Hey, I hear J. Edgar schtups his personal assistant and makes him wear ladies hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else are you hearing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That this Welles Noonan character has developed quite a crush. That you might want to consider relocating to Dogdick, Delaware.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been a marked man for years Mick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the bullseye on your back's never been quite so big...if you need a new line of work, I got this faygele leading man needs replacing- -follow Mickey's gaze over to ROCK ROCKWELL. Buff McMan Meat-   * the guy with Glenda at the Bethune party. He's primping with    * other boys decked in surplus SS uniforms, checking the side     * mirror of one of the `Alien craft' before his big close-up.     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His agent told me he could play straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His agent lied.                                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You interested?                                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But I am interested in your                       * leading lady. Bradley sent me. Saw                    * her at the Bethune-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -not a chance. I'm still trying to play hide the submarine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want Chief Bradley angry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten years ago I could call for that                   * little Pisher's head on a stick. (looks around) And now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now the only thing you're putting on sticks are corn dogs. What's her name, Mick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glenda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still looking for HER)                           * Why was she there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Low-budget strategy: I send Glenda and Rock to any event where there's cameras -- Glenda gets guest-a'- honor treatment everywhere with that shape a' her's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What she drive? 30   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - NIGHT                              30 Following the tail-lights of a 56 Corvette. Top-down, whipping Blond hair split-second visible under passing street lights. Glenda pulls into what I guess is her place: tiny- tidy Glendale flat. I roll past: no eye contact. Around the block. Park on the next street over. Waiting until I think of what comes next...get out now... 31   EXT. GLENDALE - NEXT MOMENT                               31 Up to a fence. Scratch it: make sure a nuts-hungry Pooch isn't slobbering on the other side. Nothing. Vault the fence. Dodge a pool. Over another fence and into-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 32   EXT. GLENDA'S BACKYARD - NEXT MOMENT                      32 -creep to a window: curtains pulled. Creep to another: there she is. Watch her: elegant fingers emanate from hands only now beginning to betray age. Watch her shake her sandals off. Arranging three coffee cups on a tray: company coming. On cue: another car. A `53 Cadillac: the Director and Rock Rockwell. I crane my neck to get as much of her as I can. She leaves the tray, cups steaming. Muffled greetings. Check the window, open. Slide it up gentle. 33   INT. TINY LIVING ROOM - SAME MOMENT                       33 Glenda clearing seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee's in the kitchen. Let's go over this quick because I'm beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're set on a place where we can stash you and Rock. It's in Topanga Canyon, two weeks-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (petulant) -two weeks? My body'll fall apart-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -think of it as 14 days of push-ups- (to the Director) Are you sure about this Sid? Seems shaky. Was this Mickey's idea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I think it's brilliant! Inspired! The two leads of Mickey Cohen's magnum opus get kidnapped! The press'll eat it up! They'll write about `Gangster Mickey,' the glory days. Couple a' headlines like that and interest in Atomic Vampires will go through the roof! (to Glenda) Who's gonna grab you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A charmer I knew in another life...George Ainge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pat myself down for a pen, scribble on my hand: "A-I-N-G-E" SID FRIZELL Is he okay with making it look real-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -he can't hit me in the face!                         * That's a deal-breaker!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be thrilled to knock me around. Plus he's holding something of mine, so we can kill two birds. He'll grab us Tuesday in front of the Pacific Dining Car.                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Hughes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about him? That angle can only help us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm dying to know...was he the Spruce Goose between the sheets? 34   EXT. GLENDA'S BACKYARD - SAME MOMENT                      34 My face folds up -- jealous-sour frown. I reach in, steal one   * of the steaming cups, bolt. Audible as I retreat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hung like a newborn and he called my tits `propellers.' Belly laughter from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The real howler: fake kidnappings always bomb. 35   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - NIGHT                              35 Parked. Tepid pulls off the stolen mug. Done. Toss it to the    * passenger side: lands on a bed of crumpled Styrofoam. Look up: the Magdalena residence looms a few doors down. Glance at the passenger seat: an envelope lined with fifty $100 bills. The name: BLEDSOE written across the front. Pick it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking I could tip Milteer off to the kidnap plot and pick up the other half of my payment... (stare at that money) Thinking I should just give the first half back now...'cuz I know right now I'll never hurt her. Toss the envelope into the glove-box, slam it shut. Scan. Two heads in one of the unmarked patrol cars I ordered. Cursory nods as they pass. Tail-lights fade. Dead quiet save my low Jazz. Fighting my drift. Check my Hamilton. 10:00. Grimace.       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sense of time. Exhaustion steals it. A full hour earlier than I told                     * Junior to meet me. I need sleep.                        * Yawn. Look up...Lucille Magdalena at her window. Sudden.          * Startling: no blouse, pig-tails, big silver-dollar nipples touch/steam glass. Pushes the curtains back even further. Adrenaline cuts through the lactic acid: wide awake now. I see her eyes aren't sex-placid or rolled back -- they're scanning -- hopeful to glimpse someone outside looking back.      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This routine had been done before. That old broad babbling about a Peeper. The only other link to Hector Magdalena's disappearance.                       * She holds her scan for a blink, a different smile, eyes sex- placid now, rolled-back now -- she just saw what she was looking for: hidden eyes staring back at her. I look to where I saw her gaze kink...unholster my .45. Get out quiet. 36   EXT. 1284 SOUTH TREMAINE, NEIGHBORHOOD - NIGHT               36 Cold for LA. Walking/scanning, .45 flush against my leg. Sticking to shadows. Cross the street: two homes down. Quiet steps. Closer: a snubbed cigarette smoulders in the gutter... Glance back up at the window, Lucille gone -- a forearm shiver flashes from nowhere blunts/blasts the back of my head. Nose-first into asphalt. Too angry to black out. Spit       * blood and scream at the same time so it sounds like drowning:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * Peeper fighting for balance, keeps running. I sprint heedless, round the corner: follow a blood-trail, panting, bleeding my own trail. Lift my eyes to see the Peeper shoulder through a fence, vanish into a backyard. Neighborhood mutts yelp a chorus. I cross the street- -those headlights swerve hard in front of me: Black Buick. I    * look down in time to watch my knee detonate a quarter-panel. I bounce off like someone yanked a leash. Crumble-yell. Hands pick me up. I fight back before I even see at whom I'm swinging: square-jawed types, eyes hidden by Bureau derbies.    * Welles Noonan gets out of the passenger-side of the Buick. Punches me as hard as he can without provocation: nothing to write home about. My gun clatters to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for Sanderline Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nod at the Peeper trail)
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: WEREWOLF RIGHT HERE GOD DAMN IT
result.heading: WEREWOLF RIGHT HERE GOD DAMN IT

dialogue.raw_text: . Still unsure what hit me. Pick-up my gun, clear my nose of gouting blood, stand, weave: a figure in black, sprinting away: PEEPER. Wipe away impact-tears, aim, realize my trigger   * finger is dislocated -- bent back ugly. Tuck the gun use my     * left hand to pop it back in -- deep growl -- re-aim: POP-POP-POP. The Peeper pitches. Visible in the streetlight: a red puff off his right shoulder. Headlights at end of the block, behind me, come to life now- Baritone of a big V-8.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -what were you firing at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only lead on Magdalena -- we're after the same guy you idiot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to one of the goons) -write that name down: `Magda-LEE- na' or `Magda-LAY-na.' (back to me) No, we were after you. But thanks for the name. Sag under the weight of my own insomnia-fed stupidity.          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assumed the Feds were smart. Assumed they were ready to stick a new probe into the LAPD's deal with Hector, like Bradley warned, like everyone feared. But they had no                        * clue and I just handed them the whole God damn thing. (beat) Like I said: I need sleep... Raise my face now, eyes intent, chin out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First punch you ever thrown Noonan? Your Mom have to teach you how because Dad was the same no-chin, Connecticut Faggot you are? Noonan stops, turns back to me: blazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I hit the Noonan family dynamic, dead-on. He winds up an overhand right: a big-bright flash, then           * darkness that feels like lying down on a sunlit lawn. FLUTTERING BLACK:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to take him in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only want to bring him in when I know he'll never leave. BLACK dissolves to something LIGHTER, then: 37   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - TIME UNKNOWN                       37 Horizontal. Someone pushed a table and two chairs to one side: space for the cot I'm on. Look up. Junior looking down: `Concerned' isn't strong enough. In his undershirt. He slips the red steno pad into his back pocket. Sit up. A balled dress shirt in my hand, blood sopped. Gaze at my Hamilton, face cracked, `5:16am'-- Fritz Koenig walks in, silver pitcher in hand. I gape up, still punchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ice. Bradley's on his way down. Toss the dress shirt to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's mine...you needed some                        * mopping up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who found me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. I got there at eleven like you said, right as two black & white's pulled up: you were out                      * cold in a gutter `round the block.                   * (this blithe little grin) Did Noonan knock you out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hit me with his car first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a nod to Koenig) The Captain was the only one here at this hour...                                      * Look from Junior and Koenig to the window behind him -- Bradley steam-rolling our way. To Koenig, conspiratorial:      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I need your help later on, can I count on it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you can. Take the pitcher from him, drop my head, douse myself, the cold cuts cobwebs. Bradley walks in, imperious. Koenig moves past -- ice forms between the two.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant was thirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Koenig closes the door. I refuse to look up at Bradley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Progress on Magdalena. I point to Junior -- happy to play teacher's pet:                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fingerprints. Clean crime scene. Canvassed the neighborhood. A senile neighbor did report a possible Peeper- -rubbing the back of my head where the Peeper bashed me-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -confirmed Peeper. Bradley turns to me:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that who knocked you out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noonan knocked me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) He's having you tailed then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he knows the Magdalena name and that I was chasing a suspect -- the                    * Peeper Lucille strips for.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows someone watches?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who he is. She has to. (back to Bradley) I want access to her juvie sheet or                    * whatever arrest records exist.                         * Rumor was Hector whored her out to                     * dealers he did business with.                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's immaterial.                                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as my teeth grit)                                 * It is if you're eliminating her as                     * a suspect-                                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -did you confirm their alibi?                        * Point to the ever-studious Junior.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spoke with a Mr. and Mrs. Preston                  * Mott of Santa Barbara, the parents                   * of Madge Magdalena nee Mott and                      * they've confirmed their visit and                    * also corroborated the argument that                  * resulted in them leaving early.                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (back to me now)                                 * One alteration to my previous orders-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -previous orders being what? Assign the Cop Noonan blames for his dead boxing probe to the case that's becoming his new crusade?                            * Bradley conjures the Roman visage...then slowly opens the      * door, staring holes in me.                                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step out Stemmons.                                   * Junior balks, looks my way: tries to mimic my sneer. I stand   * and shove him toward the door. His look back at me: Judas.     * Bradley closes the door behind him.                            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No direct approach on the mother or                  * the daughter.                                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Madge was a battered wife and                    * Lucille was a suborned whore. If                     * that's not motive, what is? You                      * want answers then we brace those                     * two hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you do so directly, if they're                    * formally questioned then Noonan may                  * find out and go after them with Federal warrants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noonan will figure out who and what Hector was sooner or later.                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes he will, so we buy time, keep him busy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -until when?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until Tom Bethune votes on the floor of the city council in two days, ratifying the official start of construction on Dodger stadium-
direction.name: direction
