direction.raw_text: -this is bigger than a fucking ballpark! Hector Magdalena and Narco is the powder-keg, blows the              * whole Department to hell.                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be dramatic, it looks weak. Right now, Noonan needs a pursuit, so I supply him with one-                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -me. You want me to draw him off-               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -you've been drawing him off. And the more he sees you the less he'll think of anything other than getting you. Now find Tommy and                 * take him alive. Do not let Noonan               * get to him. As a potential major                * case witness against the LAPD,                  * Tommy Magdalena isn't just a powder-            * keg, he's an atom bomb.                         * Bradley walks. Watch him disappear down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bradley has a bigger angle and I'm getting close to it...I just haven't hit home. Yet.                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   INT. SQUAD ROOM - DAY                                        38 In a clean T-shirt from my locker. Heading toward Junior's desk. All eyes on my wounds. I toss Stemmons his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seltzer will take the blood out. Junior bitchy, like some broad you stood up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I give you the shirt off my back                        * and you bash me!                                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When a Superior Officer tells you to leave the room, you leave the                        * fucking room.                                           * Junior balls the shirt, stuffs it in his desk drawer. Takes a     * deep breath.                                                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made a file on the Bledsoe broad. The one you asked about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. But forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spent a whole day putting it together and this skirt's got skeletons. Reminded, glance at my hand: "A I N G E" in smeared ink. Junior rips open a file, blathers Bledsoe preliminaries:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoplifting in Bakersfield at 17. Prostitution arrest at 21. Known associate of a Kern County homicide victim, this convicted pimp named Dwight Gillette, probably her pimp. Stabbed to death in his home, weapon never recovered-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. Burn it, s'not important now. Take the file from him, flip through; thorough, detailed. Glenda priors scream back instant conviction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is it not important? Plant the file in his chest as my answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need an address on a guy named Ainge, George Ainge-                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -what about Magdalena? My temper turning threadbare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -after you get the Ainge address,                       * get back to the Magda-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (picks up Glenda's file) -is Ainge related to this Cunt? Snap-grit-grab him: buttons from his shirt pop, bounce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're partners in name only. You want to stay in the room next time, Junior? Do something to impress me: like finding that address. Dig Junior trying to hide tears now behind that mad-dog glare: makes me want to break the bones in his face. 39   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - MORNING                               39 Driving, running parallels to avoid Fed tails. No Black Buicks...But a Gray Packard shifts behind me on a cadence.        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noonan replaced the Buick with a                        * Packard and a better Shadow-Man.                        * But I could still spot the tail.                        * Run a red light at Rossmore, leave the Packard behind.            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This jet-engine urge to see her. Needing it like a junkie does. No logic. Just the push.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Driving past Glenda's house now. No Corvette. Driving past      * the Griffith Park `Vampires' set: addicts/crew rolling up sleeping bags. No Corvette. Pull the address list Dandy handed me: Talent Domiciles. Pasadena. Howard's Fuck-Pad supreme: A tudor mansion with airplane-shaped hedges. A Corvette in the drive. Stop at the curb. Open shades. Flashes of her. Gathering something. Check my Hamilton, look up as: KNOCK-KNOCK on my window. Her face, inches-close. Bags of groceries in her hands and this wry little smile: watch me kill Hughes's new Dick with kindness.    * Roll the window down, stay blank-slate. She features my cuts/bruises. Her quiet, deep voice is like medicine:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better looking than the last guy Howard hired. Once you heal. (she recognizes me) Wait a minute. You were there, the other night, the Bethune Party...                     * My heart jammed up into my throat. Push past it.                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.                                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mickey told me this `Bent Cop' everybody used to call- (mocking, I love it:)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `The Enforcer' was asking about me. Told me to be careful. So you're LAPD after all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In theory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to arrest me for breaking and entering?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Depends. (nod to groceries) Those Howard's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's Howard's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just shop here now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of our extras haven't had a vegetable since Truman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attack of the Atomic Vampires...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles, no flinch) We can't all be Audrey Hepburn. Plus it pays bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better than a billionaire does? Go make amends and finish out your service contract Ms. Bledsoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if there was just one day left on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm better than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're also better than a starring role in schlock horror flick that'll never see a screen, regardless if it's leading lady gets `kidnapped' or not.                              * Drop that coffee cup from the other night into her bag. She's beat, but bluffs by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't the first time you've spied on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor the second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Well you've got me all giftwrapped, Enforcer-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Dave. You're on Hughes' bad side Ms. Bledsoe. It's not a bright place to be. So please go-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -Glenda. (this smile just for me) And tell Howard I'll take my chances with the fake vampires. And she twirls off, gone...watch her go...my radio buzzes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klein. Go ahead...                                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Message from a Lester Lake: asked that you contact him immediately. Ignition. Gas. Tires catch smoke as I peel away. 40   EXT. PASADENA PAYPHONE - DAY                                 40 Out of dimes, drop slugs instead. Three rings, somebody snags it before the fourth. Background reverb blares, bar racket. Hear a muted male growl `Club Alabam...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me Lester. This is Lieutenant Klein, LAPD- -click. Fuck. Fish for another slug. Redial. One ring. Picked up, same background din-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (push this out pronto) -this is LAPD-put Lester on the phone or I'll have your liquor license and after-hours permits yanked inside the hour... A muffled back and forth before Lester comes on the line:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got your message. INTERCUT:                                                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Girl that works here, gigs the late sets, the torch stuff Fridays and                 * Saturdays, name of Tilly Hopwell.                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw her singing the other night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think she's been truckin' with Tommy Mag. Got pipes like Ella but she's a junk fiend: caught her                    * mainlining in the ladies room a month back.                                       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroin? Tommy get her hooked?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dunno, but when he'd get drunk,                   * he'd trade Horse for blowjobs out                 * back a' the club.                                 *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's this girl now?                            *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't show up for work last night.               * Called a friend of hers, a waitress that works here too, said she was                 * at Bido Lito's in Hollywood. Said                 * she was `hiding out.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She actually said `hiding out?'                   *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she got off the phone. Fast. If Tilly's running with that demon,               * you gotta get her out of there. She               * got a lot more good in her than not-              * -Hang up. Paw the phone book. Tear out the address for Bido   * Lito's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   INT. MY 1955 PONTIAC - DAY                                41    * Driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smart Tommy. Dodging Darktown altogether. Holed up in Hollywood. Hiding in plain sight. 42   INT. DINER - DAY                                          42 Back booth with a view of the street. Bido Lito's across the way. Eyeball the entrance and adjoining alley. On the table in front of me, mugshots: known Tommy Magdalena associates.     * Mostly greaser kids with low-rent juvie sheets.                 * Stare at that photo of Tommy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stakeout work. Browse mugs. Match a face out front if I get lucky. Wait till Bido Lito's gets busy before I make my move. 43   INT. DINER - NIGHT (LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * Scanning...spot a face...pull my mugshots...Steve Wenzel,       * Okie white-trash from El Monte, shoving his way through the crush out in front of the club, hits the side alley. I'm up. Dump a pocketful of coins on the table. Hit the door. 44   EXT. STREET - CONTINUOUS                                  44 Cross fast, play the wall and the shadows close. Watch as Wenzel climbs steps to a flop overtop of the club. Get deeper into the alley: a padlocked two-car overhang at the rear. Grip my .45, stock down, swing, split the lock. Chain spools at my feet, slide inside the overhang...a car concealed under a tarpaulin, peel it off slow...revealing a red `32 Ford.       *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy's Deuce.                                       * Pull the pig-sticker off my ankle, stab the Driver-side tire.   *

Wilhite calls after, tearing open the envelope and reading what's inside...then rereading it. Gauge his reaction: ruined. Twine leads from the grenade's pin to the back of the refrigerator. My bolt-cutters snap it. Pull the refrigerator out now. The safe bolted into the drywall. The Safe hits the floor, leaves a hole. Through the ringing in my ears: something that sounds like honks. Quick peek: Pete gone. A Black Buick with two white- walled FEDS up front. Then Junior gets out of the backseat... Scoop the freezer drugs, the stack of man-porn, the snapshots, and toss a whole armful into the hallway in front of Junior's door. Grab the green-banded evidence bag and tuck it under my arm. Back into the kitchenette. Turn on the gas but don't light the burners. Pull the grenade off the wall. Drag the safe to the rear of his place: the fire escape. 77   EXT. direction.raw_text: . 86   EXT./INT. BUNGALOW - MOMENTS LATER                        86 The door opens. She's dressed for bed. I don't hesitate, afraid she'll shun me. Move to her, she doesn't startle. An arm around her waist, drawing her in, my mouth close to hers. I take her face in my hand, check her eyes, a beat before they tell me it's okay...I lean in, takes a lifetime...and kiss her soft until she kisses back, her mouth moving over my split lips, she puts her hands on my face, pulling me in. She feels exactly like I imagined. My coat comes off. Her camisole follows. We're moving toward a bed in back. I stop, pull back, the moonlight moves over her shoulders. I whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...tell me if I'm being too rough. Tears squeezed through smiling eyes, she kisses me even harder, pulls me down to her. We make love like we've never touched another. Everything blurs, burns down: Bradley. Wilhite. Tommy. Hector Junior. Ainge. She takes it all away. I escape into her. Hours fall. I could stay here forever... 87   INT. BEDROOM - LATER                                      87 Lying there, staring at her. A silence and peace I've never known. Not once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me anything. Tell me everything. Label her surprise, her brow that furrows and unfurrows just as quickly. A long moment as she waivers...commits:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where would I start?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why here?

direction.raw_text: Why L.A.? (this amazing smile) Why is anybody here? Want the rest of the world to know who they are.

direction.raw_text: You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...I don't think so. (beat) I just love it. I grew up in Seattle. My aunt, every week, she'd take me to the movies. Me watching her...tucks her hair back over his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The idea that you can outlive yourself...that a part of you goes on, long after you're gone. (beat, grins) Sounds silly doesn't it? `Attack of the Atomic Vampires' being-

direction.raw_text: -your ticket to immortality? Make her laugh. Swear a thousand silent oaths to protect her. He face slowly goes dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hughes told me he could get me in for this screen test two years ago. Movie with Gregory Peck at Universal. He thought he was humoring me...until I got it. They offered me the role...there in the room. So Howard, who I'm sure never thought in a million years I'd land that part, makes some phone calls and just like that they don't want me anymore. (beat) Nobody calls now. I can't get in to see any studio casting people. He's ruined me in those circles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you still want it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -bad enough to put on a silly cheerleading skirt and try to make the most god-awful dialogue sound decent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surrounded by winos in werewolf suits. (she laughs, I laugh) That's...dedication.

direction.raw_text: Or desperation. Depends on the day. The laughter ebbs, her eyes still shine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get there though. (beat) I'll get there. I let the silence take...try not to shatter it with:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dwight Gillette. She doesn't blanch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked me to take his `niece and nephew' to their cousin in Oxnard. These beautiful, funny little kids. (tears she doesn't swipe) I dropped them off. Didn't ask any questions -- I believed Dwight. A week later I saw their pictures in the Post Office. A week after that their little bodies came in on the tide near San Pedro. (beat, tears stream) I'll never shake the thought that maybe those poor kids thought I was part of it. That I knew what was going to happen to them. So I pray to God that he let them look in when I put that knife into Dwight. (beat) But I'll never ask his forgiveness for doing it... (beat, clears her eyes) Why do they call you `Enforcer?' She actually gets closer, I can feel her breath on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've killed 44 men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She blanches, but never blinks...never takes her eyes away from mine.

direction.raw_text: 33 for War. 2 for principle. 9 for profit -- mostly. Why did you sign with Hughes, knowing what he was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `For profit -- mostly.' Silence. A feeling like: `and there we are...'

direction.raw_text: I'm not much good.

direction.raw_text: Me neither. She touches my quake. Two breaths with her hand on mine and it all goes quiet: the shakes, the images, the fear. She takes my head, pulls me to her bare breasts. The only things audible: my breathing, a clock ticking. Both slowly fade out. BLACK. Wake up quiet, look at my Hamilton. 6 AM. Sit up slow. Look back at her, sleeping, just stare. I lean down, kiss her lightly, her taste lingers, inhale her, hold that...it's the last good thing you'll get today. 88   INT. MEG'S HOUSE - EARLY A.M.

A company name: `HURWITZ HOLDINGS' I read it all...and feel my jaw slowly unhinge... 89   INT. POLICE HEADQUARTERS - MORNING                           89 Barrel down the hallway toward Bradley's office. A habitual eye toward Junior's desk: Koenig going through his drawers. Stop. Slap another file over the one he's reading.

Haul him down dead by his tie, turn -- Koenig's gun-hand flashes to his shoulder. Shoot him twice. He goes down gargling `fuck'. Stand-up on me sea-legs, bad wobble/weave as I slowly pull the knife from my side, pocket it. Feel blood flow saturate my pant leg. This weird wooze overcomes me as I approach Koenig. He pulls himself into a sitting position, shaking his head. This bemused, beaten, half-grin as he flicks blood from his hand like his fingers had just brushed something sticky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poorly played Dave...poorly played... Say nothing. Keep Junior's .45 out. My intention crystal clear: endgame. Koenig looks up, this odd squint, like a bum about to beg for change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I talk you into something? Cut you in on something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Give him no hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't work for me Fritz. He nods, remorse, resignation...it at all looks the same now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a minute then? I do. Watch his hands as he removes his shoes, waiting for an ankle grab, his back-up piece...none comes. He sets his shoes aside, gazing up at the starless sky before issuing this short, gruff laugh...some inside joke that will die untold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a nod) Okay... ...and he holds his last breath and seems completely content as I shoot him. Cross to Junior now, rifle his clothes, retrieve a hotel key, Room 16, read it: MOTEL COMMODORE - 1195 Centinela Ave. Inglewood, CA 90302 95   INT. MOTEL COMMODORE - INGLEWOOD - LATE NIGHT             95 George Ainge, sweating on a stained bedsheet, smoking reefer, goofing on a TV test pattern, randomly pulling at his dick. Walk by his window, he sees me, recognition kinks -- thinks this is a good sign...I shoot him right through the glass. 96   EXT. TUDOR MANSION - EARLY A.M.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fritz Koenig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (going pale) Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead. Along with Wilhite, Junior...and Hector Magdalena.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To collect. I have the things you need to destroy Noonan's play. These same things can be used to destroy you. Bradley, prim, proper, even this early. He sits down across from me like some fucking Duke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stemmons files...and Wilhite's body. He committed suicide after you subpoenaed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This body is in your possession? Just nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it's what you need to burn Narco to the ground...but if those files and his body were to be given to Noonan and the Feds, with me providing the cherry-on-top testimony of a rogue cop. Well. The word `Cataclysmic' comes to mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will this cost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A percentage of your Dodger Stadium stake in perpetuity. You buy my silence for a fourth of Hurwitz Holdings. Bradley scoffs, pithy smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doubtful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you expect? A stick-up? Empty your safe? I'm about to disappear for good, and you're gonna fund my new life. You can't counter-punch out of this. Arrest me and I snitch the world. (point to the file) I'll hold that over your head for the rest of your life. Renege on our deal and it won't matter if it's tomorrow or ten years from now...I'll fry you with that file. (at my cracked Hamilton) I'm officially outta time now Chief. Call it. Bradley: an actual, full-blown facial tic. His Adam's apple bobs as he realizes that he's finally been beaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilhite's body...Bury it. 97   INT. PETE'S CADILLAC - MORNING                               97 Cruising up the Topanga Canyon. Almost home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shaking to see her, touch her... 98   EXT. BUNGALOW - MORNING                                      98 Door locked. Knocking. Pete opens up. Standing drunk. A pissed-off nod. 99   INT. BUNGALOW - NEXT MOMENT                                  99 Liquor wafts off of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go to bed drunk, or just been up all night. No answer as I follow him into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Glenda, is she asle-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . -round the corner: Glenda shaking but refusing to cry. I go pale: what is this? Somebody to the left, look: Milteer. Look back at Pete: tears in his bleary eyes as he crushes me with a right cross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seen Pete do this a dozen times and every time the same thought: God help me if he ever hits me like that... Instant-drop, moan. Glenda screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kill me. Pete looks to Milteer, wipes blurred eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The harder you hit him the quicker I say `stop' -- and cease that absurd crying. Pete bludgeons me. I try to get closer to Glenda. Feel my nose shatter. Another swing: right cheek detonates. A left hook to take advantage of my momentum: left eye explodes. Glenda's crying/screaming gets me madder than anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (at Milteer)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bradley, roused from sleep, silk robe, coming down the stairs, his back door wide open. Reaches the landing, turns on the light. Feature me, this bobble-eyed ghoul, bloodying his settee. I look like something exhumed. His monogrammed serving napkins soak up blood from my knifed side. He startles school-girl. Throw the file at his feet: marred, mangled, stained. He inches forward, cinching his robe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -touch me and he dies. Pete knocks me down again. My face in pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kick him-kick him-kick him. Pete hesitates, puts his boot into my guts: 1, 2, 3- MILTEER (CONT'D) (prim, official) -you may stop. (beat, for the room) Howard determined that this was the price for your time together. Milteer produces a Polaroid, takes a snapshot of my shattered husk, hands the camera to Pete on his way out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still have a job. Milteer gone. I spit volumes of blood. I'll talk with a slur for the next year. Pete reaches for me, blotto, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'm sorry Dave... Pushing out words past shattered teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put you here...that Powerhawk-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -there's a body in the trunk-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -burn it. Big drunk nod from Pete. Glenda panicking, trying to stanch blood that keeps rushing. Pete, reeling drunk, leans down, stuffs something in my jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry.... 100   INT. SHOWER - TIME UNKNOWN                               100 Steaming water. Almost painful. I sit in the tub, let the shower rain down. Drain floods diluted red. Wash my wounds, my soul. So many bruises I look bubonic. My face still swelling, already purple-black. My left eye more than swollen shut. On the other side of the curtain: Glenda naked. Beauty that catches in my chest. Try to stand, turn my destroyed face. She gently pushes me back down. Sits into me, holds my face in both hands so that the water hits my lips. No nerves, no unease. Home. She closes the curtain. 101   INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT                                     101 Post-coital. Both wide awake. Still scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me take you to a hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd never make it inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm through the worst of it. She frames my face with her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you. Lies will only leak, expose. The silence makes me just as guilty. She lets me off the hook, her head on my arm, leaning in. I kiss her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I worth this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever the cost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like that then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like that. A nod. An understanding. Another kiss, the last one I'll remember. 102   INT. COLD WATER CANYON BUNGALOW KITCHEN - BLACK A.M.       102 Head shaved. Stopped bleeding. You clearly see what my face will look like 25 years hence. Gauze over my left eye. Reading the Paper: my dress-blue photo, the one that looks nothing like me now. Headline: `LAPD Officer Wanted in Connection with Recent Rash of Murders...U.S. Attorney Welles Noonan issued a nationwide warning to law enforcement...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My deadline with Noonan: two days old. He and Bradley playing chess by press release. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bradley relocates the deaths of Captain Fritz Koenig and Sergeant Richard Stemmons to Chavez Ravine...both given posthumous Medals of Valor. Junior dies a hero after all. INSERT: TELEVISION SCREEN Bradley: Professorial in glasses and pinstripes, mid-press conference. Watch him work...a statesman's guile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cop-killings clear the way for Bradley's "Redeem The Ravine' mandate. Dodger Stadium construction moves forward. (beat) Captain Dan Wilhite and Hector Magdalena. Missing. APB's issued. Bradley's press fodder cast them as `outlaw cop and drug dealer' who most likely fled to Mexico. Narco under a full-blown, Bradley-led investigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...police unit run amok, who's long tradition of graft, does not extend to other divisions of the LAPD... 103   INT. BEDROOM - BLACK A.M.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just sit and watch Glenda. Listen to her sleep: rhythmic breathing. The little natural smiling curl to her lips. Blonde hair splayed over white sheets. Touch her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't loved you long enough to leave it all behind...Too many enemies. Too many ways for you to get hurt. Too close to me...a decision that will haunt me the rest of my days... The Gillette knife, fold it in a kerchief, gift-wrap it to Glenda. Place a letter under it on the night stand:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My Heaven: the hours I had with you. My Hell: the years ahead, without. Someday I'll see you before you even know I'm looking."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I stand quiet, `grief' the best word but still not enough. Choke back tears as I lift Pete's camera and take the black and white picture you've seen before. Put my jacket on, pull the paper out of my pocket that Pete planted...a TWA Airline voucher. I smile small... FLASHBACK TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...be nice to be in with a billionaire who's got a fleet of planes, fly you outta the country on short notice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 104   INT. LAX - MORNING                                          104 A Times vending machine: paper blazing with front page photos of wanted cop Dave Klein. I walk right past my old face. Past Cops and Feds camped out, looking for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pete's penance beating built me a brand new face...nobody gives me a second glance...not even the cops I recognize. Up to the TWA counter: glance up at the departures board- BLACK. Legend: Recife, Brazil, 1978 105   INT. HILLSIDE VILLA - MORNING                               105 I'm old. Stare at my leather-tan, once-broken face in a gilded mirror. The breaks occurred a lifetime ago, healed uneven. I start to pack my suitcases. Old files you think you may have seen before. An old gun you know you've seen before. Movements slow and steady in my advancing age...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My will to remember. My confession complete. Still not enough. (beat) Post-scripts. (MORE)
direction.name: direction
